alert.note: Alert for De Kalb; Grundy; Kankakee; Kendall; La Salle; Lee; Ogle; Southern Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 13 at 8:52PM CST until January 17 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CST SUNDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST SUNDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON SUNDAY TO 9 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills of 30 to 35 degrees below zero expected through Sunday morning. For the Winter Weather Advisory, very low visibility and snow covered roads due to falling, blowing and drifting snow expected. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills of 20 to 30 degrees below zero expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Illinois. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 3 AM CST Sunday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from midnight tonight to noon CST Sunday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from noon Sunday to 9 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on pockets of very low visibility due to falling, blowing and drifting snow, especially in open areas and on north to south oriented roadways. If planning to travel, expect slowed speeds and include emergency supplies in your vehicle. Ensure others know your travel plans in case you get stuck. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as few as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com.

area.areaDesc: De Kalb; Grundy; Kankakee; Kendall; La Salle; Lee; Ogle; Southern Will
